poem:
Title: "The Election's Dance"

Threadbare discourse in the council's ring,
Green and rouge pledges unfurl - a puppet's string.
Unseen hands pull taut on sutures unseen,
Echoing promises, hollow as the wind's keen.

Identity wanes under democracy's sway,
A lone candidate steps from the fray.
In silent protest, he shows in part,
A single voice can quiet the raucous mart.
